section.heading: Purpose and Scope.
section.text: The purpose of these regulations is to describe the Voluntary Parentage Acknowledgment Program.

para.text: The Administration shall maintain and monitor a parentage acknowledgement program in cooperation with:
Hospitals;
The Maryland Department of Health, Division of Vital Records (MDH/DVR); and
Other participating entities as designated by the Administration.
The program shall provide unmarried parents an opportunity to voluntarily acknowledge parentage of a child by providing:
Written material about establishment of parentage;
A standardized affidavit of parentage form;
Oral and written notice of the legal consequences and the rights and responsibilities of acknowledging parentage; and
The opportunity to speak with individuals employed by participating entities who are trained to clarify information and answer questions about establishment of parentage.
The Administration shall supply participating entities with a standardized affidavit of parentage form which provides the following information:
A statement that an executed affidavit of parentage is a legal document and constitutes a legal finding of parentage;
A statement that the affidavit may be rescinded by either parent in writing within 60 days of execution of the affidavit;
The full name of the child, and the child's place and date of birth;
The full name of the parent who gave birth to the child;
The full name of the parent who did not give birth to the child;
The signatures of the parents of the child attesting, under penalty of perjury, that the information provided on the affidavit of parentage is true and correct;
A statement by the mother consenting to the assertion of parentage by the other parent and acknowledging that:
The mother’s cosignatory is the only possible father of the child; or
The mother and the mother’s cosignatory consented to the conception of the child by means of assisted reproduction with the shared intent to be the parents of the child;
A statement by the individual who did not give birth to the child that:
The individual is the father of the child; or
The individual and the child’s mother consented to the conception of the child by means of assisted reproduction with the shared intent to be the parents of the child; and
The personal Social Security number of each parent, or if a parent has no Social Security number, an assertion by the parent that the parent has no Social Security number.
The Administration shall supply participating entities with:
Affidavit of parentage forms; and
Training on the:
Completion of the form;
Alternatives to voluntary acknowledgement of parentage;
Legal consequences of the executed form; and
Rights and responsibilities of the parents signing the form.
Upon the birth of a child to an unmarried mother in a Maryland hospital, the hospital administrator or the hospital administrator’s designee shall:
Provide an opportunity for the child’s parents to complete an affidavit of parentage; and
Forward the executed affidavit of parentage to the Maryland Department of Health, Division of Vital Records.

Upon request, authorized individuals employed by participating entities shall provide an affidavit of parentage to an unmarried mother or the individual who did not give birth to the child who wishes to acknowledge the parentage of the child.
A properly completed affidavit of parentage shall be:
Witnessed if signed in a participating facility or agency;
Notarized if not signed in a participating facility or agency; and
Forwarded to the MDH/DVR at the address provided on the form.
The Administration shall:
Maintain and stock informational brochures about the benefits of establishing parentage and the availability of child support services in Maryland; and
Provide the brochures to participating entities.
Upon the birth of a child to an unmarried mother in a Maryland hospital, the hospital administrator or the administrator’s designee shall furnish the brochures to the parents.
